description: Debuted by Starbucks in 1996, the Caramel Macchiato has been a café favorite for over two decades. Learn how to craft this coffee classic at home with this simple recipe. Make it frothy with a mix of smooth vanilla and velvety caramel for the perfect amount of sweetness. Top it off with a drizzle of caramel for a coffee that tastes as delicious as it looks.
name: Caramel Macchiato
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Espresso Roast by Nespresso® capsule​
homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Pour vanilla syrup into the bottom of your mug.
In a separate container, froth the milk and then pour into mug.
Prepare 1 shot of Starbucks® Espresso Roast by Nespresso® and pour through the foam.
Drizzle caramel sauce on top. Enjoy!

description: This Starbucks classic combines espresso, bittersweet mocha sauce and steamed milk for a sweetly satisfying coffee. Top it off with whipped cream and chocolate shavings for a delicious mug of coffee ready to be enjoyed any time at home.
name: Caffè Mocha
recipeIngredient: 1 oz  Starbucks® Espresso Roast ground coffee or

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of espresso and pour into a mug.
Froth your milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Add mocha sauce into your mug and gently stir into the coffee.
Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full.

description: You know it and love it. Craft your own creamy and delicious caffè latte at home, featuring Starbucks® Espresso Roast.
name: Caffè Latte
recipeIngredient: Optional sweetener of choice such as homemade Vanilla Syrup (or storebought)

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare espresso shot and pour into mug once brewed.
Stir in optional sweetener.
In a separate container, steam and froth milk until you have a light layer of foam.
Gently pour the steamed milk into the brewed coffee while holding back the milk foam from glass.
Top with the thin layer of milk foam remaining in the container. Enjoy. ​

description: Espresso meets white chocolate in this classic Starbucks® drink. Learn how to make a White Chocolate Mocha at home, then top it off with a dollop of whipped cream for a sweet, creamy beverage that delights with every sip.
name: White Chocolate Mocha​
recipeIngredient: 4 Tbsp white chocolate chips or chopped white chocolate

recipeInstructions.text: Heat up white chocolate chips on low heat until softened.
Prepare 1 shot of espresso and pour into a mug (1 shot = 1 oz).
Stir hot espresso and softened white chocolate together.
Froth 2% milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Pour frothed milk into mug.
Top with whipped cream.

description: A beloved café favorite, the Caffè Misto is easy to make and adore. Simply combine the well-balanced taste of Starbucks® Caffè Verona®, luscious crema brewed by Nespresso® Vertuo, and frothed milk to create this delightful cup.
name: Caffè Misto
recipeIngredient: 1  brewed coffee capsule of Starbucks® Caffè Verona® for Nespresso® Vertuo
4 oz 2% milk (or any creamy non-dairy alternative)​

recipeInstructions.text: Brew 1 capsule of Starbucks® Caffè Verona® for Nespresso® Vertuo into a 16-oz mug.
Froth milk using a Nespresso® Aeroccino on the heated setting or a handheld frother. ​
Add frothed milk to the mug.​

description: Sweet and salty goodness. Mix up your coffee routine with the café-inspired Pistachio Latte featuring Starbucks® Espresso Roast.
name: Pistachio Latte
recipeIngredient: 1 oz espresso shot of Starbucks® Espresso Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in a small pot. Bring to a boil then lower to a simmer. Remove pistachios from shells and chop.
Add in the chopped pistachios and continue to simmer for 8–10 minutes. Stir occasionally to dissolve sugar.
Remove from heat. Let cool slightly before straining through a fine mesh sleeve. Stir in almond extract.
Store in a container in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Slice butter into even pieces and place in a light-colored pan over medium to medium-low heat.
Stir gently as butter melts, foams and turns a golden-brown color.
Once foam and milk solids settle to the bottom, remove from heat. Store in a heatproof container.
Prepare espresso shot.
Add the Pisatchio Syrup and browned butter, stirring gently.
Froth milk and pour over the coffee. Learn more about enhancing your frothing skills by visiting our milk frothing guide.
Sprinkle with crushed shortbread cookies.

description: Bring your favorite fall coffee home! Follow this simple recipe to create a cozy, homemade Pumpkin Spice Latte from scratch.
name: Pumpkin Spice Latte

recipeInstructions.text: Combine sugar and water in saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Once sugar is dissolved, add cinnamon sticks, ground cloves, ginger, nutmeg and pumpkin purée, and let simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and immediately strain through cheesecloth.
Heat and froth milk in a Nespresso® Aeroccino frother. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Brew Starbucks® Espresso Roast in an espresso machine or stovetop moka pot, or brew a Starbucks® by Nespresso® Espresso Roast capsule in a Nespresso® machine.
Place Homemade Pumpkin Spice Syrup into a mug, followed by hot espresso. Stir together.
Fill mug with heated frothed milk until ¾ full, then top with whipped cream.
Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice!

description: Time to cozy up by the fire. Celebrate the season with this delicious peppermint and white chocolaty recipe featuring new Starbucks® Holiday Blend for Nespresso® Vertuo and Starbucks® White Chocolate Flavored Creamer.
name: Peppermint White Chocolate Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1  brewed coffee capsule of Starbucks® Holiday Blend for Nespresso® Vertuo
1 oz Starbucks® White Chocolate Flavored Creamer
1  peppermint puff candy (or other desired peppermint candy)​
Whipped cream as garnish, if desired

recipeInstructions.text: Place the peppermint candy into a 12-oz mug and then brew 1 capsule of Starbucks® Holiday Blend for Nespresso® Vertuo on top.
Froth milk and Starbucks® White Chocolate Flavored Creamer together using a Nespresso® Aeroccino on the heated setting or with a handheld frother. ​
Add frothed mixture into your mug of coffee. If desired, top with whipped cream. Enjoy.

description: Rich vanilla-flavored coffee, creamy oatmilk, sweet vanilla syrup and nothing else. The beauty of this recipe for Nespresso® Original Line lies in its simplicity. Make yours and craft a moment of calm in your day.
name: Double-Vanilla Oatmilk Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 2  brewed espresso shots of Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee by Nespresso®

recipeInstructions.text: Pour vanilla syrup into a 12-oz mug.
Brew 2 shots of Starbucks® Vanilla Flavored Coffee by Nespresso® into the mug.
Froth oatmilk using a Nespresso® Aeroccino on the heated setting or a handheld frother. If using a frother, warm milk before frothing.
Gently pour frothed milk into mug until almost full. Spoon any remaining foam on top.

description: The Flat White combines steamed milk and rich, dark espresso for a creamy coffee-forward drink that’s worth savoring. If you’re feeling creative, the Flat White is also the introductory drink used for baristas who are learning to make latte art, so feel free to use this coffee as a delicious canvas.
name: Flat White

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 2 shots of espresso and pour into a mug.
Froth whole milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.

Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full, then focus on the middle of your mug and pour a little faster so the foam will come out without moving your pitcher. As the foam starts to come out, continue to pour until you get a dot in the middle.
Feel free to try your hand at latte art.

description: The Starbucks® Blonde Vanilla Latte: where fluffy frothed milk and delicious vanilla syrup come together over a shot of espresso for a drink that’s smooth, delicious and invigorating. Learn how to make a delicious café-style vanilla latte at home with only three ingredients.
name: Starbucks® Blonde Vanilla Latte
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso® capsule

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare 1 shot of Starbucks® Blonde Espresso Roast by Nespresso® and pour into a mug.
Froth milk. If using the Nespresso® Aeroccino, froth milk on the medium froth setting.
Add vanilla syrup to your mug of espresso and gently stir in.
Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full.
Spoon any remaining foam onto the top of your beverage.

description: The perfect sweetness of caramel meets with the taste of juicy apple in a new fall favorite. The hearty spices in Starbucks® Fall Blend adds depth and richness to a cup that’s made for crisp fall mornings. Enjoy our Salted Caramel Apple Crafted Coffee all season long.
name: Salted Caramel Apple Crafted Coffee​
recipeIngredient: 6 oz brewed Starbucks® Fall Blend K-Cup® Pods (or ground coffee)
Dash of ground cinnamon for garnish
Rolled vanilla wafer cookie for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Stir together loosely packed brown sugar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer over low heat.
Once sugar is dissolved, add cinnamon, ground cloves, salt and apple sauce. Let simmer for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat. Strain through fine mesh strainer into a bowl until all liquid has dripped through. Gently stirring can help the liquid pass through the strainer.
Stir in caramel sauce while the sugar mixture is still warm.
Store in a covered container in the refrigerator for up to 7 days.
Add Salted Caramel Apple Syrup to a 12-oz mug.
Brew 6 oz of Starbucks® Fall Blend directly into the mug. Stir.
Froth 4 oz whole milk using your desired method for warm frothing. Once frothed, add to the mug.
Top with any (or all) of the following: whipped cream, a drizzle of caramel, a dusting of cinnamon or a rolled vanilla wafer cookie for stirring.

description: The richness of cookie butter and cinnamon spice. The humble goodness of oatmilk. The delicious smoothness of Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee. The Oatmeal Cookie Café Au Lait is wholesome, familiar and truly scrumptious.​
name: Oatmeal Cookie Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 8 oz brewed Starbucks® Veranda Blend® or Starbucks® Veranda Blend® K-Cup Pod
4 oz oatmilk, traditional milk or your favorite milk alternative
1 Tbsp cookie butter to melt for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Add 8 oz Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee to a 12-oz mug.
Heat oatmilk, traditional milk or your preferred alternative with cookie butter, sugar and cinnamon. Froth.
Add cookie butter mixture to mug.
Top with whipped cream and a drizzle of melted cookie butter.

description: Sea salt, whipped cream and caramel flavors meet in your mug for this delicious drink. With one sip, it’s easy to see why Starbucks® Salted Caramel Mocha is a café favorite. Learn how to make this sweet, salty, delicious drink at home with this recipe.
name: Salted Caramel Mocha​
recipeIngredient: homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Add toffee nut syrup and dark chocolate sauce into the mug.
Prepare shot of espresso.
Stir hot espresso into chocolate and toffee nut flavorings.
Froth 2% milk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Pour frothed milk into your mug.
Top with whipped cream, drizzle of caramel sauce and sprinkle of smoked sea salt and sugar topping.

description: A recipe for the true pumpkin spice aficionados out there. A mug of Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Naturally Flavored Coffee and Creamer are topped off with whipped cream and a dusting of pumpkin pie spice. To all our pumpkin spice fans out there, this one’s for you.
name: Triple Pumpkin Spice Coffee
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Naturally Flavored Coffee K-Cup® Pod
2 Tbsp Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Flavored Creamer
2 pinches of homemade pumpkin pie spice (or store bought)

recipeInstructions.text: Place all ingredients in a small jar that seals tight.
Shake to combine.
Add Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Flavored Creamer and sugar into an empty mug.
Brew 8 oz of Starbucks® Pumpkin Spice Naturally Flavored Coffee K-Cup® Pod directly into mug.
Stir and top with whipped cream.
Sprinkle pumpkin pie spice on top of whipped cream.

description: Learn how to make a Honey Almondmilk Flat White, a delicious and dairy-free take on the classic café beverage where each sip offers just a hint of delectable honey.
name: Honey Almondmilk Flat White​

recipeInstructions.text: First, make the honey syrup. Combine 1 cup of honey and 1 cup of water in a small pot on the stove over medium heat until lightly simmering.
Let simmer for 5–7 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and let cool for 20–30 minutes. You can store your honey syrup in the fridge for up to 7 days.
Prepare 2 shots of espresso and pour into a mug.
Add 1 oz of honey syrup to the mug and stir.

Froth almondmilk using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here. As you froth your milk, try using a spoon to gently push the microbubbles to the bottom of the pitcher. This will result in a smoother, more velvety texture for your flat white.

Gently pour your frothed milk into your mug until it’s almost full, then focus on the middle of your mug and pour a little faster so the foam will come out without moving your pitcher. As the foam starts to come out, continue to pour until you get a dot in the middle.

description: Wake up to an intoxicating swirl of vanilla, turmeric, ginger, cinnamon and pepper.  Our Golden Turmeric Latte recipe is a delicious new twist on your favorite Starbucks® drink. Spice up your morning routine, and treat yourself to a swirl of spices right in your cup.
name: Golden Turmeric Latte
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® by Nespresso® Blonde Espresso Roast capsule

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the oatmilk in the Aeroccino frother and froth on medium setting.
Combine espresso shot, vanilla, turmeric, ground ginger, cinnamon and dash of black pepper with milk and gently stir.
Sweeten with honey to taste.
Top it off with a dollop of foam.
Optional: Sprinkle ground cinnamon on top.

description: In this festive recipe, brown sugar, molasses and cinnamon come together to highlight the delicious spiced notes of our Starbucks® Gingerbread Flavored Coffee.
name: Sweet & Spiced Gingerbread Coffee
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp brown sugar, plus a sprinkle for garnish
0.125 tsp cinnamon, plus a sprinkle for garnish
8 fl oz Starbucks® Gingerbread Flavored Coffee K-Cup® pod, brewed

recipeInstructions.text: Place molasses, brown sugar and cinnamon into a mug.
Stir in brewed coffee.
Froth milk and pour over the coffee.
Top with a sprinkle of cinnamon and brown sugar.

description: Caffè Americano is an Italian interpretation of “American coffee” that swaps out milk with hot water for a simple espresso drink that has become a staple at our cafés. Learn how to make the Starbucks® classic at home, all it takes is two ingredients and a steady pour.
name: Caffè Americano

recipeInstructions.text: Bring water to a boil and pour into your mug.
Prepare 2 shots of espresso.
Slowly pour your 2 shots of espresso into the water.

description: Spice up your daily cup. A bit of cinnamon and nutmeg (and a pinch of cayenne) give your coffee some bite. Cocoa and sugar add a note of sultry sweetness. And warm milk smoothes it all out for a perfectly flavorful cup.
name: Mexican Coffee Recipe
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp brown sugar or powdered sugar
6 oz brewed coffee (try Starbucks® House Blend)
0.333 cup whole milk or half and half

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the sugar, cocoa powder, cinnamon, nutmeg and ground cayenne together in a large mug.
Pour in the coffee.
Pour in the warm milk or half and half.
Top with a dollop of whipped cream, if desired.

description: Rich chocolate and nutty flavors in every sip. Learn how to make this warming Hazelnut Mocha au Lait at home with Starbucks® Mocha Flavored Coffee.
name: Hazelnut Mocha au Lait
recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp chocolate syrup + 1 tsp for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Pour Hazelnut Syrup into a mug and add brewed Starbucks® Mocha Flavored Coffee. Stir.
Froth milk and pour over the coffee. Discover your preferred frothing method by visiting our milk frothing guide.
Top with whipped cream and drizzle with chocolate syrup.

description: Directly translating to “White Hazelnut,”  our Hazelnut Bianco recipe is a wonderfully light-colored espresso drink with accents of white chocolate and hazelnut flavors.
name: Hazelnut Bianco
recipeIngredient: 1 cup  whole milk (or milk of your choice)

recipeInstructions.text: Using a Nespresso® Aeroccino frother, froth milk on medium setting.
Add milk, shaved white chocolate and prepared espresso shot to mug.
Serve with a spoonful of hazelnut spread, gently stirring to dissolve.

description: Take your favorite mug on a trip with our Cuban coffee recipe. Cuban coffee is all about technique. While getting the sugar just right takes a little bit of skill, it’s more than worth it for this delicious take on espresso. The way you know you’ve made a great Cuban coffee is by your espumita (little foam), which is the layer of foam on top of each cup of espresso.
name: Café Cubano​ Recipe

recipeInstructions.text: Fill your moka pot with water until just up to the steam release valve.
Fill your moka pot funnel filter to the top with ground espresso, lightly press and level out.
Put the top chamber on the moka pot, ensure it's twisted on tight, and put the pot on a stovetop burner at medium-high heat.
While the coffee is heating, put 4 heaping tsp of sugar into a 12-oz metal creamer.
Wait for the first bit of coffee to percolate out, then take a tsp of coffee and pour it into your sugar.
Using the back of the same teaspoon, grind the coffee and sugar against the wall of the metal creamer for 60 seconds until consistent and paste-like.
Once all coffee is brewed, remove your moka pot from the burner. Pour the remainder of your coffee very slowly into the sugar paste.
Serve into espresso cups, ensuring a fine layer of foam.

description: Enjoy the best of both worlds with this unforgettable beverage, where espresso swirls together with the classic combination of chocolate flavor and orange zest.
name: Orange Mocha​

recipeInstructions.text: Over medium heat, add milk to your saucepan and bring to a simmer.
Add in mocha sauce, brown sugar and orange zest; whisk briskly to create a layer of foam.
Pour milk mixture into espresso; separating and discarding the orange zest.
Prepare espresso and pour into the center of your mug.
Top with whipped cream and fresh orange zest.
Prepare espresso and pour into mug.

description: Long summer days mean more time for warm and toasty marshmallow-topped coffee.
name: Toasted Marshmallow Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Toasted Graham Flavored Coffee K-Cup® pod

recipeInstructions.text: Brew one K-Cup® pod of Starbucks® Toasted Graham Flavored Coffee.
Stir chocolate into hot coffee.​
In a separate container, froth 2% milk using your preferred method. You can use a handheld milk frother or froth your milk by hand. Read our frothing guide here.
Pour frothed milk into your mug.​
Top with 2 marshmallows and sprinkle of graham cracker crumbs. For s’more summer flavor, toast your marshmallows over a bonfire.

description: Better days start with a sweeter sip. Welcome the sun with creamy oatmilk and a bright drizzle of honey.
name: Honey Oatmilk Café Au Lait

recipeInstructions.text: Combine honey and water in a small saucepan.
Bring to a boil and then lower heat to a simmer.
Simmer for 5–7 minutes while stirring occasionally.
Place 2 Tbsp of Honey Syrup in a mug.
Pour in Starbucks® Veranda Blend®.
Foam extra creamy oatmilk and pour into the mug. You can use a handheld milk frother or froth your milk by hand. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.

description: A little whiskey goes a long way in this coffee cocktail. Nothing melts away the chills like piping hot coffee and a shot of Irish whiskey—preferably mixed together with a bit of brown sugar and topped with a heaping scoop of whipped cream. Here’s how to whip up this cold-weather favorite for a few lucky friends.
name: Irish Coffee
recipeIngredient: (for homemade whipped cream, 1 cup heavy whipping cream + 1 Tbsp sugar)

recipeInstructions.text: Stir brown sugar, whiskey and coffee together in a tall glass.
Top with a scoop (or two) of whipped cream.
Finish it off with a sprinkle of nutmeg.

description: Learn how to make a delicious honey latte … then caramelize it! Superbly sweet and delightfully creamy, this is the perfect drink to brighten any winter day. Crafted around Caffè Verona®, our Caramelized Honey Latte recipe is dripping in caramel and honey flavors dancing over a bed of roasty sweet coffee with notes of dark cocoa.
name: Caramelized Honey Latte
recipeIngredient: 2 oz brewed Starbucks® Ca­ffè Verona® Whole Bean Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Place the honey, water and lemon juice in a small pan and bring to a steady simmer on medium heat while stirring.
Once the honey mixture begins to bubble, stop stirring and let the honey sit for 1–2 minutes until it deepens in color and releases a nutty aroma. That’s how you know it is caramelized.
Slowly pour and whisk in the milk until combined. Remove from heat.
Prepare espresso.
Combine the caramelized honey milk and espresso into your favorite cup.
Froth milk using your preferred method, and top with a drizzle of honey!

description: A popular tradition in Mexico and Spain, this beverage often features rice, milk and cinnamon. Learn how to make a quick, delicious version with Starbucks VIA® Instant Coffee.
name: Instant Coffee Horchata
recipeIngredient: 0.5 packets Starbucks VIA® Instant Italian Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Soak rice in the water overnight, or for at least 1 hour.
Add the rice and its soaking water to a blender, along with the vanilla, cinnamon, sugar and Starbucks VIA® Instant Coffee. Blend for 2 minutes.
Strain the blended mixture into a storage container and stir in the milk.
Cover the container and chill the mixture completely (overnight is optimal).
When you’re ready to serve the horchata, pour it into a serving pitcher, leaving any sediment behind.

description: Macchiato is an espresso drink with a small amount of milk, which is usually frothed. In this recipe, complementary flavors of maple syrup and cinnamon dance together over a delicious espresso base.
name: Maple Cinnamon Macchiato​

recipeInstructions.text: Combine maple syrup and oatmilk and froth in Nespresso® Aeroccino frother on high setting.
Brew lungo shot and add frothed milk, top with flavored foam.
Sprinkle with cinnamon.

description: A simply delicious way to flavor your brew. Dropping a couple sticks of cinnamon into your coffee press adds the perfect amount of spice to your favorite brew. Here’s how to get the cinnamon-to-coffee ratio just right.
name: Cinnamon Coffee
recipeIngredient: 6 oz hot water, just off the boil

recipeInstructions.text: Add coffee grounds and broken cinnamon sticks to the coffee press.
Pour in the hot water, saturating the coffee and cinnamon.
Place the plunger on top of the press, but don’t push down.
Let brew for 4 minutes, then push the plunger all the way down.

description: With maple, vanilla and brown sugar, this recipe puts everything sweet into one delicious cup of coffee. Top it with whipped cream and cinnamon for an extra layer of yum.​
name: Maple Vanilla and Brown Sugar Coffee
recipeIngredient: 8 oz Starbucks® Maple Pecan Flavored Coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Maple Pecan Flavored Coffee.
Stir half-and-half, brown sugar, and vanilla  extract into brewed hot coffee.
Top with whipped cream and cinnamon (optional).

description: Learn how to make your own café au lait at home. Pronounced café o-lay, French for “coffee with milk,” this recipe is a perfect blend of sweet chocolate and caramel, all balanced with a light hint of salt.
name: Salted Caramel Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 3 tsp dark chocolate sauce or syrup
homemade Caramel Sauce (or storebought) for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Start with adding dark chocolate sauce and toffee nut syrup to your cup.
Add a pinch of sea salt.
Pour in hot coffee and stir to dissolve.
Add milk; cold is great, but hot is better.
Top it off with whipped cream, caramel sauce and a sprinkle of sea salt.

description: Elevate the classic Americano with orange syrup, frothy milk and a sprinkling of demerara sugar.
name: Americano Con Crema

recipeInstructions.text: Make the orange syrup first. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, add water, sugar and orange peel. Stir occasionally for 5 minutes or until sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat and let cool. Strain into a container.
Next, make the Americano con Crema. Froth the milk in a blender on high for 2 minutes, then let it sit for 1–2 minutes.
Prepare 2 shots of espresso and pour into a mug.
Add the orange syrup, espresso and ¼ cup of hot water to a mug and stir.
Top the beverage with a few spoonfuls of milk froth and sprinkle with sugar if desired.

description: Grab your favorite childhood cereal and brew something equal parts delicious and nostalgic with our Cereal Milk Coffee. This recipe uses Veranda Blend® for a warm and sweet drink that tastes as timeless as cartoons and cereal.
name: Cereal Milk Coffee​

recipeInstructions.text: Combine cinnamon cereal and whole milk. Heat using preferred method. Steep for 4 minutes, then spoon cereal out of milk. You can also steep the cereal longer to increase the cereal flavoring.
Froth remaining cereal milk and sugar using your preferred method. For more information on how to froth your milk, see our frothing guide here.
Pour brewed Veranda Blend® coffee into a mug.
Add frothed cereal milk.
Top with whipped cream and remaining 1 Tbsp of crushed cereal.

description: Rise with the sun and break out the coconutmilk to make the most of the day with this delectably sweet and creamy morning coffee.
name: Honey Coconut Café Au Lait
recipeIngredient: 3 Tbsp whole milk or your milk of choice

recipeInstructions.text: Pour your milk, coconutmilk and honey into a milk frother and proceed to froth to your liking.
Brew your Starbucks® Veranda Blend® coffee in a coffee brewer or coffee press.
Pour your brewed coffee into your favorite mug and slowly pour your frothed milk into the coffee to taste. We recommend 3 parts coffee to 1 part frothed milk.
Top your mug with any extra foam from the flavored steamed milk and a drizzle of honey to taste. Garnish with a sprinkle of toasted coconut.

description: Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa is known for being perfectly sweet—and in this recipe, excitingly spicy too. Try this simple, quick recipe for a delicious and complex chocolate-flavored beverage.
name: Spiced Hot Cocoa
recipeIngredient: 1  Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod

recipeInstructions.text: Brew 1 Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod (8 oz).
Pour directly over Five Spice Blend in your favorite mug.
Stir until well mixed.
Top with whipped cream and an extra sprinkle of Five Spice Blend.

description: Starbucks VIA® Instant coffee meets butterscotch in this sweet recipe that’s sure to be a new morning favorite.
name: Starbucks VIA® Butterscotch
recipeIngredient: 1 packet  Starbucks VIA® Instant Medium Roast Colombia coffee

recipeInstructions.text: Pour your Starbucks VIA® Instant coffee, butterscotch and sugar into a mug.
Heat your milk by pouring it into a microwave-safe container and heating it on medium-high power, stirring every 15 seconds until steam begins to rise from the milk.
Stir together your coffee mixture and heated milk until the butterscotch chips are fully melted.

description: Brew a sweet cup of hot cocoa, add maraschino cherry juice and top with whipped cream for a delicious way to wind down the day.
name: Cherry Hot Cocoa​
recipeIngredient: Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod

recipeInstructions.text: Add 2 Tbsp cherry juice to your favorite mug.
Brew 1 Starbucks® Classic Hot Cocoa K-Cup® pod (8 fl oz) directly into mug and stir.
Top with whipped cream and cherry.

description: Treat your taste buds with this warm and white chocolaty drink. This muddled minty mocha is a rich and luscious way to satiate your sweet tooth and revel in a delightfully minty finish.
name: Muddled Mint White Chocolate Mocha

recipeInstructions.text: Brew Starbucks® Mocha Flavored Ground Coffee (or K-Cup® pods) double-strength.
Add white chocolate mocha sauce to your cup.
Add hot coffee to cup, pouring directly over white chocolate sauce.
Stir vigorously to dissolve. In a separate glass, muddle fresh mint and ice.
Pour coffee mixture on top of the fresh mint and ice. Top with whipped cream and a sprig of fresh mint.

description: Starbucks® Holiday Blend, cherry cream and just a hint of almond? Sounds like the perfect way to top off the holidays. From that first sip, this delightful holiday recipe will become the sensation of your season.
name: Starbucks® Holiday Blend Café Au Lait with​ Cherry Almond Sweet Cream

recipeInstructions.text: Combine heavy whipping cream, cherry juice and almond extract in a bowl. Whisk or blend with a mixer until very soft peaks form. Set the sweet cream aside.​
Pour coffee into a mug and sweeten as needed to your liking.​
Froth the milk, then pour into a mug.​​
Top with desired amount of cherry almond sweet cream and enjoy.​
